name: pushing the edge improv
description: I wanted to push the edge and try something different from what is normal plus i like advancement ice. I am really looking for suggestions on improvement.

name: Cached Memories v0.1
description: Work in progress. I found PeekaySK's "Stealing ain't that hard" interesting and wanted to try an adaptation with the cards I have on hand.

name: Nasir
description: My 1st take on Nasir.

name: Nasir b2
description: My second take on Nasir. Hope you like it. Many thanks to all who inspired me with this deck!

name: PE Cerebral Cast Recursion
description:
Inspired from http://netrunnerdb.com/en/decklist/8847/nisei-scorch- , but trying to go fully on the never advance & #Cerebral Cast paths.

A bit of ICE had to be cut, as well as the Sea Source & one Scorch. Scorch can be used twice in a row with an Archived Memory, but not on the same turn that you use Cerebral Cast. Useful though to blow up a plascrete and keep the threat running so that the runner choosing the tag rather than the brain would always be a bad idea.

name: First Jinteki
description: The objective is not to flatline, but to slow the runner down while scoring agendas.

name: BP 3
Natural Clone
description: With inspiration from umbralAeronaut's Urban Warfare deck, I wanted to fit in Clone Chip and get back to the lovely e3 Feedback Implants.

name: PPVP Kate
Tennin Get out of my house!!
Jintecki RP - TSB 2.7
KatePad 3.0
HB FA 2.0
Criminal Network v2
description: Build up your network of contacts while putting steady pressure on the central servers. Mr. Li helps cycle through your deck faster to find those interfaces; use Window to draw the second card if needed. Use Hostage to find The Helpful AI which triggers your Underworld Contacts. Calling In Favors helps in the mid-to-late game (where Criminals tend to lose steam) to boost tempo and maintain pressure.

name: Eat, Sleep, Tutor, Repeat
description:
Yes, fellow WWE fans, I went there!

So, for this iteration of Professor, I've taken PeekaySK's extremely versatile concept as well as the Dirty Hands idea...and I've sorta mashed them together as if I was making a S'mores with A:NR deck concepts. :)

The basic idea here is to get out Leprechaun as early as possible...and if you can't, then at least build up some credits and hope for a good draw. After Leprechaun enters play, get that Opus hosted, then start building your rig (breakers, pressure and ICE destruction...OH MY).

Levy AR Lab Access is there, obviously, for when you need to push that reset button if things aren't going well.

Dinosaurus is there so you can tailor your breakers to fit the current situation (should be easy to tell which breaker to host on it at the time so that the Corp's rig melts more efficiently). It's not the cheapest console, but it's not very expensive either, especially with Modded on your side.

Keyhole, Imp, Nerve Agent, and Sneakdoor Beta are your pressure points. If anyone has advice on which card to remove here to put in Medium, please feel free to tell me. :) This SHOULD be sufficient pressure though, I think.

The usual Professor suspects (Scavenge, Test Run, and Clone Chip) all play an integral part as always...and then there's Diesel, which is integral in getting a good start. Even if found in the mid-game, it can be a good asset.

As always, feedback welcome!

name: Nasir loves Monoliths
description:
Based off of "Big girls play with monoliths," this variant uses Nasir's ability to help generate the credits needed for a Monolith.

The really big issue here is Archer, for which I've included Sharpshooters. But once you have your big breaker suite, everything becomes cheap to get into.

Another change is specific to Nasir: we need clone chip/parasite, so using datasuckers and the larger, in-faction breakers are more important than using the anarch fixed breaker suite. I'm not totally sold on just one femme as the sole 'real' sentry breaker, but with the sharpshooters, it seems okay so far. More playtesting needed.

name: Horizontal Tag & Bag
description: Horizontal Tag & Bag, with backup beale/midseasons.

name: Rig Meidan
description:
New Nasir build I'm still working on. Idea is to use procon to cycle through your deck, burst Econ to help both apply some early pressure with indexing and faerie, as well as get out a toolbox and maybe rdis to convert into a strong late game position.

The major change here, was I dropped personal workshop in favour of modded for extra early burst Econ. I found often, I was still paying close to full price for things I put on the workshop just so I wouldn't lose the money, so I figure why not just install it up front.

Played a few games with this approach and it seems fine, a bit tricky to decide when to run and with how many credits, but I've found running poor early on with Meidans ability often nets you free accesses on hq and r&d. Net celebrity was in here before, it's ok, it wasn't a super star so I dropped it for now, but it does help with pop up.

name: Will Encrypt for $
description:
Fun build with lots of code gates and will-o the wisp.

After playing some games with it, it's actually quite ok, encrypted portals hasn't been good at all in any games though... Even late game, often you will only have 2 or 3 code gates rezzed and the plus 1 isn't that big a deal at that point. House of knives might be better, running the extra one pointers works pretty well, since people often think it's just an ash, Jackson, caprice or something; which let's you score them out.

Targeted marketing is interesting, you need to wait until you land willo once to name it though, since there seems to be a lot of diversity in breakers.

name: Zone Melting - Metallurgic raffination
description: It is impractical to play a Corp with only agendas and operations but with the Foundry one can get close to that scenario. As the ID name indicates it separates the (NEXT) metal ICE from the rest. To ensure that the agenda ratio in R&D does not rise too much, the operations core contains plenty of recycling, not to forget Jackson Howard.

name: HB Fast Advance v0.1
description: Help me make a decent, fun corp deck with just Core, Cyber Exodus, Future Proof, and Creation & Control? I don't know what I'm doing o(╥﹏╥)o

name: Listen to the Noise
Tricksy Bluff Kill Deck Small
description:
Make money, protect central with meager ice, install tons of obvious bluffs then trick of light their advancement tokens onto 3/2s and 3/1s for further mindgames. Aim to keep at least 4 credits in hand for snare fear, 1-2 advancement tokens on every advanceable remote server and to have a ton of them installed at once. Fill the table with horizontal cards baby~

Susceptible to R&D milling decks somewhat (even though most agendas are 1point), I need to get shock for this deck to work in conjunction with the snares and cause some pain/fear for R&D burners.

Susceptible to expose decks, only real protection against these is Psychic Field.

Susceptible to account siphon/security testing but credits shouldn't help a runner to do much.

name: Hot Hitter Horizontal
description:
Make money, install tons of obvious bluffs then trick of light their advancement tokens onto other traps..

Susceptible to R&D milling decks somewhat (even though most agendas are 1point), I need to get shock for this deck to work in conjunction with the snares and cause some pain/fear for R&D burners.
